title: If the cost price of 50 oranges is equal to the selling price of 40 oranges, then what is the profit percent? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let cost of 1 orange =1 Rupee Cost of of 50 oranges (50 rupees)= Rupees 50 = selling of 40 0ranges (40 rupees) Rupees 50 40 oranges selling price = 50 Each orange selling price = 40 /50 = 4/5 =1.25 25 Paise profit on each orange Percentage of Profit (25/ 100 )×100 =25% Algebraic Model Cost of 50 oranges = x rupees Cost of 1orange =x/50 Selling price of 40 oranges = x rupees Selling price of 1 orange = x/40 Profit = x ( 1/40 --1/50) = x (1/200) =x/200 Profit %= [x/200/ x x/50]×100 =25% Profit =25%

The CP of 50 oranges is the same as the SP of 40 oranges. Profit percent = (SP-CP)*100/CP Let the CP of 50 oranges by 50x The SP of 40 oranges = 50x, or the SP of 50 oranges = 50x*50/40 = 62.5x Profit = (62.5x–50x)*100/50x = 12.5x*100/50x = 25%. Answer.
